channel.title: This Computer Sucks
channel.description: Well, this computer is a virus magnet. It's so slow, like nothing opens up but MSN and Firefox. I think I'mk going to format, I'm just not very computer-"literate". Any suggestions :(

item.title: This Computer Sucks
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:125, topic:69219”][quote author=YourDistracted link=topic=101698.msg1047696#msg1047696 date=1174798458]
Actually i would have to say that 2k is the best member. Faster, more secure (I know its surprising) Vista is GUI upgrade of win2k its good
[/quote]

That = true. The only things I don’t like about Windows 2000, are that it doesn’t have a cool bootup screen (yeah, I’ve heard of BootXP), and support for Windows Live. I love the way (in 2k) how you can just drag in the cmd window to copy - just like mirc :)[/quote]
Yeah, I agree. There are ways of giving Win2000 “eye candy”, though.

Read full topic

item.title: This Computer Sucks
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I find it funny how instead of giving a reason to why Vista is slower than XP, you find in easier to point out a slight mistake in my quote.

Read full topic

item.title: This Computer Sucks
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:115, topic:69219”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=101698.msg1040245#msg1040245] And at one of the posts earlier stating that Vista is faster than XP on a fast machine. Bullshit. That is the biggest load of crap I’ve ever heard. That’s like saying XP runs faster than 98 on a fast machine. Why do you think MS added RAM caching to Vista? Because Vista is slow, that’s why. Vista has so much other crap running that it doesn’t even have the resources to open a fucking program. Don’t believe the crap MS tells you about how they added RAM caching so that Vista ‘could take full advantage’ of the operating system. Anyway, 1GB of ram isn’t enough for Vista. An IBM consultant said that 4gb is the sweet spot for Vista.
[/quote]
Nope, you’re wrong, period.

I have a fairly old notebook (was damn good at the time). It has 1 GB RAM, 128 ATI MobilityRadeon X300, and 1.73 ghz. Well, it runs Vista + Aero (with glass) 100% perfectly, without even the slightest bit of lag.

But I do agree with Mopman. While it is a pretty good operating system (don’t say it isn’t, it’s just simply still “in the making.” XP was the EXACT SAME WAY), it doesn’t offer much more than XP, besides the UI.[/quote]

That is hardly fixed, and I find it amazing that you haven’t noticed the ‘quote’ button.

Also we’re offtopic now

Read full topic

item.title: This Computer Sucks

item.description:

this from someone who can’t even make a quote properly …

Anyway, Vista is not the piece of shit everyone says it is, they just think they are above everyone else because they can talk shit.

item.title: This Computer Sucks
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:111, topic:69219”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=101698.msg1044232#msg1044232 date=1174741854]

lol YZ u serious? Why would they make a newer os worse than a previous.

Because they are M I C R O S O F T. Microsoft. thats what they do.
[/quote]

You do know that microsoft is a very successful company, and that vista is one of the most complex pieces of software ever. And that 10gig of extra files cannot just go towards the UI ;)[/quote]

Ya, it also goes to all the options to configure the UI. Also, that and about a billion .hlp files on the new UI options. Oh and the Microsoft SpyBot.

[quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=101698.msg1047636#msg1047636 date=1174797583]

[quote=“Rictoo”]slow[/i], that’s why. Vista has so much other crap running that it doesn’t even have the resources to open a fucking program. Don’t believe the crap MS tells you about how they added RAM caching so that Vista ‘could take full advantage’ of the operating system. Anyway, 1GB of ram isn’t enough for Vista. An IBM consultant said that 4gb is the sweet spot for Vista.
[/quote
Nope, you’re wrong, period.

I have a fairly old notebook (was damn good at the time). It has 1 GB RAM, 128 ATI MobilityRadeon X300, and 1.73 ghz. Well, it runs Vista + Aero (with glass) 100% perfectly, without even the slightest bit of lag.[/quote]

this from someone who can’t even make a quote properly …

Read full topic

item.title: This Computer Sucks
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Rictoo:

And at one of the posts earlier stating that Vista is faster than XP on a fast machine. Bullshit. That is the biggest load of crap I’ve ever heard. That’s like saying XP runs faster than 98 on a fast machine. Why do you think MS added RAM caching to Vista? Because Vista is slow, that’s why. Vista has so much other crap running that it doesn’t even have the resources to open a fucking program. Don’t believe the crap MS tells you about how they added RAM caching so that Vista ‘could take full advantage’ of the operating system. Anyway, 1GB of ram isn’t enough for Vista. An IBM consultant said that 4gb is the sweet spot for Vista.

Nope, you’re wrong, period.

I have a fairly old notebook (was damn good at the time). It has 1 GB RAM, 128 ATI MobilityRadeon X300, and 1.73 ghz. Well, it runs Vista + Aero (with glass) 100% perfectly, without even the slightest bit of lag.

But I do agree with Mopman. While it is a pretty good operating system (don’t say it isn’t, it’s just simply still “in the making.” XP was the EXACT SAME WAY), it doesn’t offer much more than XP, besides the UI.

Read full topic
